page.title: 01GIRVAN Ayrshire Holiday Town
page.content: With its safe,sandy beach on the FIRTH of Clyde,hills to the South and East and farmland to the North,it is ideally situated to cater for the tourist trade upon which it is heavily dependent.During the summer season { {Girvan's}winter population of 8500 can be trebled. Easy access is provided by road, rail and air.A working harbour and busy boat repair yard are sources of interest. Golfing,bowling,putting and swimming are available and holiday shows are given in the Beach Pavilion. Ten miles off shore lies{Ailsa} {Craig,}a well known landmark and bird sanctuary.Around{Girvan}the famous early potatoes are grown.
